intro: Geranium novum, commonly known as the New World geranium, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically features serrated, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Geranium novum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its blooming period spans from late spring to early autumn, adding vibrant color to gardens throughout the growing season.
